2019-02-13 11:25:55 Bruno Carlin <bruno.carlin@waarp.org> src/main/java/org/waarp/openr66/context/task/AbstractExecTask.java v 98a352f5e2e9e6bf1d079d9c82b72d6c10976879

fix the command run on windows in exec tasks

In EXEC* tasks on windows, if slashes are used for the executable, the resulted
command executed is:

EXECUTABLE EXECUTABLE ARGUMENTS

with the first EXECUTABLE having antislashes and the second one slashes.

This patch returns the command to its normal form :

EXECUTABLE ARGUMENTS

add TRACE level log for all packets in network and local codecs
2019-02-01 10:43:19 Bruno Carlin <bruno.carlin@waarp.org> src/main/java/org/waarp/openr66/context/filesystem/R66File.java v 930390cd80d5316e6a7093f45d59eeb0256ed770

Removes the error when changing from ERROR to DATAS

The test to check whether data packets must be sent is done in the loop
condition (running.get()). However, if the stop order is given while the future
is waiting (which effectively pause the loop), a new packet was sent, even if it
should not. This caused an error when the internal state machine tried to go
from ERROR to DATAS.

Checking the value of running _after_ the promise has returned prevents this
packet to be sent and removes the error.
2019-01-22 17:18:02 Bruno Carlin <bruno.carlin@waarp.org> src/main/java/org/waarp/openr66/protocol/localhandler/ConnectionActions.java v 988ff63e10968cd3a607c6b810e9f47008940258

Stop reading file when the transfer is stopped or canceled
